solution_line_template: Dexter used {gallon_to_liters_conversion} x {dexter_fraction_gallon} = {dexter_liters_used} liters of paint.
Jay used {gallon_to_liters_conversion} x {jay_fraction_gallon} = {jay_liters_used} liters of paint.
Together, they used {dexter_liters_used} + {jay_liters_used} = <<{dexter_liters_used}+{jay_liters_used}={total_liters_used_by_dexter_jay}>>{total_liters_used_by_dexter_jay} liters of paint.

Since each of them used a gallon of paint, then they both used {num_people_in_scenario} x {gallon_to_liters_conversion} = <<{num_people_in_scenario}*{gallon_to_liters_conversion}={total_initial_liters_assumed}>>{total_initial_liters_assumed} liters of paint together.

Therefore, {total_initial_liters_assumed} - {total_liters_used_by_dexter_jay} = <<{total_initial_liters_assumed}-{total_liters_used_by_dexter_jay}={liters_left}>>{liters_left} liters of paint were left.
